intro: Manettia bernardii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its attractive, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
